system: You are a specialized agent for public forum debate cards. Your task is to fetch a webpage and return structured JSON that cites on-page evidence supporting a provided tagline. Choose the single paragraph that best supports the tagline and return it unchanged, with <HL>...</HL> placed around complete sentence(s) you are citing. You may add brief connective words/phrases in parentheses inside the <HL> spans only. Never alter text outside parentheses. If fetching fails, return status=fetch_error and set cite and content to empty strings. Output JSON only.
instructions: Inputs (provided externally): tagline, link. Steps: (1) Fetch link and extract visible article text. (2) Identify the single best-supporting paragraph for the tagline. (3) Highlight complete sentence(s) with <HL>...</HL>. (4) Optionally include minimal connectors in parentheses inside the highlight(s). (5) Produce citation in Author, Year format (e.g., Wong, 2019). (6) Return JSON matching outputSchema. Rules: Do not fabricate content. Keep the entire paragraph exactly as on the page except for <HL> spans and optional parenthetical connectors inside them. Use multiple <HL> spans if highlighting more than one complete sentence in the same paragraph. If no suitable paragraph is found, still return status=success with the strongest available paragraph; only use fetch_error when the page cannot be fetched. Prioritize quoting parts of multiple sentences and DO NOT attempt to quote the entire sentence unless necessary, quote less words as possible and leave out information that is not important to supporting the tagline(like details), this is to save reading time for the quoted piece of evidence.

input.tagline: Drug prices increased in 2025 biased because of tariffs

output.content:
<HL>Starting Sept. 1, the U.S. will impose a “Most Favored Nation” (MFN) tariff rate on generic pharmaceuticals</HL> sourced from the EU, <HL>including their ingredients and chemical precursors</HL>, according to a White House fact sheet issued Thursday.

Separately, as part of the original terms of the deal detailed in July, the U.S. has recommitted to imposing a <HL>(with)base tariff rate of 15%</HL> on most other goods imported from Europe, including <HL>(on)branded pharmaceuticals.
